definition: to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
muddy/to mix
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
surname Yu
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]

sentences.english: The pusher, not qualified products to sell fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 致使不法商贩浑水摸鱼，出售不合格产品。

sentences.english: All they wanted was to make bad blood between them, aggravate differences and fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 他们就是要挑拨离间，扩大分歧，以便浑水摸鱼。

sentences.english: Really bald in La "fish in troubled waters" in the felling of trees.
sentences.chinese: 真的光头强可在腊人“浑水摸鱼”在砍伐树木。

sentences.english: During the decline of the stock market , some people fished in troubled waters and made big money.
sentences.chinese: 在股票市场下跌期间，一些人浑水摸鱼，赚了大钱。

sentences.english: You can fish in troubled waters.
Obviously, they want to fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 显然他们打算浑水摸鱼。

definition: to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain/also written 渾水摸魚|浑水摸鱼
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
to take advantage of sb's misfortune/to loot
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
to have an ulterior motive (idiom)
to profiteer/to gain some underhand advantage
benefit from others' dispute (idiom)
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
to harbor evil intentions (idiom)
lit. to pull chestnuts out of the fire (idiom)/fig. to be sb's cat's-paw
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
(coll.) to gain profit (usu. by underhand means)
